input_text:
Job Title: Implementation Manager

Location: El Segundo, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Details

Job Location

Remote - EL SEGUNDO, CA

Position Type

Full Time

Who We Are

About Us:

As a company, we promote a culture of honesty and integrity, and value the trust it allows us to build with customers and employees alike. Our focus on our people is what sets us apart and keeps our customers coming back to work with us!

If you are seeking to be a part of a family, this is the place for you!

Maersk Warehousing and Distribution USA LLC handles end-to-end warehousing and distribution logistics needs utilizing our strategic network of storage facilities. Our facilities are capable of receiving, storing, processing and dispatching cargo, so we can build flexibility and resilience into the supply chain process. Our integrated solutions allow us to be prepared for supply chain risks, so we can plan distribution to better achieve lead time and goals despite unexpected conditions. Our extensive experience, connections, and deep expertise across different sectors, industries, and transportation modes, means we can be counted on for process excellence that will save time and money.

Description

Summary:

The Implementation Manager is responsible for managing multiple large-scale and small-scale logistics implementation projects and all related activities of those projects. The IM will perform the following duties personally or through associated project resources and clients; all internal and external communications, project plan development, task, resource, and financial tracking, and executive status reporting.

Job Responsibilities

Develops and maintains project plans to include all systemic, operational, and customer requirements. Drives the tasks to ensure that each project is completed in a timely fashion and meets the company and customer expectations.Provides input to the development of project management strategy and research & development of new and emerging methods.Establishes and conducts progress report meetings for projects. Ensures that communication flows to all parties involved and maintains direction and order during meetings. Ensures that detail and sidebar discussions of related project topics are conducted timely and are included into the overall flow of communication once resolved.Represents the interests of the company and protects the company’s image with the customer, related vendors, and external parties. Actively builds a good rapport with clients. Keeps an understanding of the associated costs in mind when guiding decision-making.Manages multiple projects concurrently. Reaches out to the appropriate decision-makers and task owners in a timely manner to keep tasks on track. Actively seeks to avoid delays to the progress of projects.Develop and maintain a working knowledge of the physical operational tasks in relation to the projects assigned.Develop an understanding of the customer needs for each project and how the stated goals fit into the customer’s business objectives. Performs administrative activities associated with the effective management of projects, including status reporting.Determines responsibilities of assigned organization and staff resources to projects in order to accomplish project business objectives.

Job Skills And Requirements

To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; gathers and analyzes information skillfully; facilitates alternative solutions; works well in group problem solving situations; uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.Leadership - Displays passion and optimism; inspires respect and trust; mobilizes others to achieve project objectives; provides inspiration and support to project participants.Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; reacts well under pressure; treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; accepts responsibility for own actions; follows through on commitments.Must have excellent communication skills; written, verbal and presentation. Requires advanced skills in Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Visio and Word High energy and self-starter. Ability to operate independently and convey a sense of urgency. Well-organized, detail oriented with excellent follow through. Problem solver, ability to think on their feet. Goal oriented and driven to succeed.Honest, fair and able to build trust.

Education

Bachelor's degree from four-year College or university; or five (5) years of relevant PM experience; or a combination of education and experience. PMP, CSM, or similar project management training or certification is highly desirableMinimum 3 years of PM experiencePrevious IT or logistics experience is highly desirable

Travel Requirements

Primary ‘home’ office site is remoteAbility to travel to Company locations by air in the US, Canada, and Mexico for multi-day implementation events that can span weekendsTravel frequency is variable and project dependent; unlikely to exceed 10% of overall work timeWork Shift and Environment:Day shift, Monday through Friday; 40 hours per week. Additional hours of work may be necessary to reach urgent project and support goals.Position is a member of Implementation Project Management team, and will be required to perform independently at remote sites.With the exception noted above, the position is 100% remote. Applicant must be able to provide a stable and professional remote working environment with excellent internet.

Supervisory Responsibilities

There are no direct supervisory responsibilities.

Company Benefits

Medical

Dental

Vision

401k + Company Match

Employee Assistance Program

Paid Time Off

Flexible Work Schedules (when possible)

And more!

Pay Range

$115,000-$125,000

The above stated pay range is the anticipated starting salary range for the position. The Company may adjust this range in light of prevailing market conditions and other factors such as location. The Company will work directly with the selected candidate(s) on the final starting salary in accordance with all applicable laws.

You must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S.

Performance Team is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Performance Team is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, color, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or perform a job, please email us at accommodationrequests@maersk.com

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
